description: Red buckeye is a unique flowering shrub native to the southeastern United States that offers floral displays unlike any other. It stands at about five feet in height and is easily recognizable by its deep red flowers clustered in prominent upright spikes. Unique to this species, the red flower are contrasted by the yellow and green, teardrop shaped fruits it produces later in the season. The Red Buckeye serves as an important food source for birds and other wildlife, yet its unique structure and vibrant colors make it an amazing asset to any garden.
